text.p: These are the leading stories in the Lebanese press on Thursday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Prime Minister Hariri accused Lebanese intelligence agencies of destroying civilian institutions.
- Iran's Foreign Minister Velayati handed President Hrawi an invitation to attend the Islamic summit meeting in Tehran in December, and an invitation to Prime Minister Hariri to visit Tehran in June.
- General Lahd, commander of the pro-Israeli South Lebanon Army militia said in an open letter to the pope that Lebanon is becoming a dectatorship.
- Israeli warplanes raided south Lebanon and west Bekaa.
- Syrian President Assad received Lebanese parliament Speaker Berri in Damascus.
- Shi'ite Moslem Sheikh Fadlallah, who is widely seen as spiritual guide of the pro-Iranian Hizbollah, said: "I hope the Pope will condemn Israel's massacres in south Lebanon".
- Foreign Minister Bouez said the structure of the United Nations including the security council must be reveiwed.
- Bouez said Lebanon is watching the U.S.-Israeli-Turkish alliance with deep concern.
- Hrawi opened meeting of the U.N.'s Economic and Social Commission for Western Asia (ESCWA).
- Hariri met Syrian Vice President Khaddam in Damascus.
- The council of Maronite bishops said the Pope's impending visit to Lebanon has united the Lebanese people.
